articles.author: Nathan Layne, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said he will hold a news conference on Thursday afternoon at his residence in Palm Beach, Florida, his first public appearance since his Democratic opponent, Kamala Harris, selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate.
articles.title: Trump to hold news conference while Harris visits Michigan auto workers

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli tanks returned to the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis on Friday, forcing thousands to evacuate along congested roadways, as Palestinian fighters continued to attack Israeli troops from the ruins, residents and the military said.
articles.title: Families flee new Israeli assault in Gaza's Khan Younis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Microsoft researchers said on Friday that Iran government-tied hackers tried breaking into the account of a "high ranking official" on the U.S. presidential campaign in June, weeks after breaching the account of a county-level U.S. official.
articles.title: Microsoft researchers report Iran hackers targeting US officials before election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina will return to her country when its new caretaker government decides to hold elections, her son said, but it was not clear if she would contest.
articles.title: Sheikh Hasina will return to Bangladesh for elections, her son says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian military said on Friday it had hit a Russian military airfield in the Lipetsk region of western Russia overnight, damaging stockpiles of guided bombs and causing a series of detonations.
articles.title: Ukraine says it hit Russian military airfield in Lipetsk region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro on Thursday said he has signed a resolution to block access to social media platform X in the country for 10 days.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro signs decree blocking X access for 10 days

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Extreme rainfall and severe flooding in China led to a near doubling in economic losses from natural disasters in July from a year earlier, the government said.
articles.title: China's rains and floods led to near doubling of natural disaster losses in July

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and surrounding areas on Friday evening, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.
articles.title: M5.3 earthquake hits Tokyo after Japan issued megaquake advisory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Iranian Revolutionary Guards said on Friday that its navy has new cruise missiles equipped with highly explosive warheads that are undetectable, state media reported.
articles.title: Iranian Guards navy has new highly explosive missiles, state media say

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's disbanded opposition Move Forward unveiled a new leadership and political vehicle on Friday that will become the biggest party in parliament, naming it People's Party, and promising to advance its predecessor's progressive platform.
articles.title: Thailand's disbanded opposition regroups under new anti-establishment party
